description: Modifies the settings for a replication group. This is limited to Valkey and Redis OSS 7 and above.

parameters.name: ReplicationGroupId
parameters.description: The identifier of the replication group to modify.

parameters.name: AutomaticFailoverEnabled
parameters.description: Determines whether a read replica is automatically promoted to read/write primary if the existing primary encounters a failure. Valid values: true | false.

parameters.name: CacheSecurityGroupNames
parameters.description: A list of cache security group names to authorize for the clusters in this replication group. This change is asynchronously applied as soon as possible. This parameter can be used only with replication group containing clusters running outside of an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC). Constraints: Must contain no more than 255 alphanumeric characters. Must not be Default. (string) ---

parameters.name: SecurityGroupIds
parameters.description: Specifies the VPC Security Groups associated with the clusters in the replication group. This parameter can be used only with replication group containing clusters running in an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC). (string) ---

parameters.name: PreferredMaintenanceWindow
parameters.description: Specifies the weekly time range during which maintenance on the cluster is performed. It is specified as a range in the format ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi (24H Clock UTC). The minimum maintenance window is a 60 minute period. Valid values for ddd are: sun mon tue wed thu fri sat Example: sun:23:00-mon:01:30

parameters.name: NotificationTopicArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic to which notifications are sent.

parameters.name: NotificationTopicStatus
parameters.description: The status of the Amazon SNS notification topic for the replication group. Notifications are sent only if the status is active. Valid values: active | inactive.

parameters.name: ApplyImmediately
parameters.description: If true, this parameter causes the modifications in this request and any pending modifications to be applied, asynchronously and as soon as possible, regardless of the PreferredMaintenanceWindow setting for the replication group. If false, changes to the nodes in the replication group are applied on the next maintenance reboot, or the next failure reboot, whichever occurs first. Valid values: true | false Default: false.

parameters.name: EngineVersion
parameters.description: The upgraded version of the cache engine to be run on the clusters in the replication group. Important: You can upgrade to a newer engine version (see Selecting a Cache Engine and Version), but you cannot downgrade to an earlier engine version. If you want to use an earlier engine version, you must delete the existing replication group and create it anew with the earlier engine version.

parameters.name: SnapshotRetentionLimit
parameters.description: The number of days for which ElastiCache retains automatic node group (shard) snapshots before deleting them. For example, if you set SnapshotRetentionLimit to 5, a snapshot that was taken today is retained for 5 days before being deleted. Important If the value of SnapshotRetentionLimit is set to zero (0), backups are turned off.

parameters.name: SnapshotWindow
parameters.description: The daily time range (in UTC) during which ElastiCache begins taking a daily snapshot of the node group (shard) specified by SnapshottingClusterId. Example: 05:00-09:00 If you do not specify this parameter, ElastiCache automatically chooses an appropriate time range.

parameters.name: AuthToken
parameters.description: Reserved parameter. The password used to access a password protected server. This parameter must be specified with the auth-token-update-strategy parameter. Password constraints: Must be only printable ASCII characters Must be at least 16 characters and no more than 128 characters in length Cannot contain any of the following characters: --/', --'', or --@', --%' For more information, see AUTH password at AUTH.

parameters.name: AuthTokenUpdateStrategy
parameters.description: Specifies the strategy to use to update the AUTH token. This parameter must be specified with the auth-token parameter. Possible values: ROTATE - default, if no update strategy is provided SET - allowed only after ROTATE DELETE - allowed only when transitioning to RBAC For more information, see Authenticating Users with AUTH.

parameters.name: UserGroupIdsToAdd
parameters.description: The ID of the user group you are associating with the replication group. (string) ---

parameters.name: UserGroupIdsToRemove
parameters.description: The ID of the user group to disassociate from the replication group, meaning the users in the group no longer can access the replication group. (string) ---

parameters.name: LogDeliveryConfigurations
parameters.description: Specifies the destination, format and type of the logs. (dict) --- Specifies the destination, format and type of the logs. LogType (string) --- Refers to slow-log or engine-log.. DestinationType (string) --- Specify either cloudwatch-logs or kinesis-firehose as the destination type. DestinationDetails (dict) --- Configuration details of either a CloudWatch Logs destination or Kinesis Data Firehose destination. CloudWatchLogsDetails (dict) --- The configuration details of the CloudWatch Logs destination. LogGroup (string) --- The name of the CloudWatch Logs log group. KinesisFirehoseDetails (dict) --- The configuration details of the Kinesis Data Firehose destination. DeliveryStream (string) --- The name of the Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream. LogFormat (string) --- Specifies either JSON or TEXT Enabled (boolean) --- Specify if log delivery is enabled. Default true.

nested_params.name: DestinationType
nested_params.description: Specify either cloudwatch-logs or kinesis-firehose as the destination type.

nested_params.name: DestinationDetails
nested_params.description: Configuration details of either a CloudWatch Logs destination or Kinesis Data Firehose destination.

nested_params.name: CloudWatchLogsDetails
nested_params.description: The configuration details of the CloudWatch Logs destination.

nested_params.name: LogGroup
nested_params.description: The name of the CloudWatch Logs log group.

nested_params.name: KinesisFirehoseDetails
nested_params.description: The configuration details of the Kinesis Data Firehose destination.

nested_params.name: DeliveryStream
nested_params.description: The name of the Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream.

nested_params.name: Enabled
nested_params.description: Specify if log delivery is enabled. Default true.

parameters.name: TransitEncryptionMode
parameters.description: A setting that allows you to migrate your clients to use in-transit encryption, with no downtime. You must set TransitEncryptionEnabled to true, for your existing cluster, and set TransitEncryptionMode to preferred in the same request to allow both encrypted and unencrypted connections at the same time. Once you migrate all your Valkey or Redis OSS clients to use encrypted connections you can set the value to required to allow encrypted connections only. Setting TransitEncryptionMode to required is a two-step process that requires you to first set the TransitEncryptionMode to preferred, after that you can set TransitEncryptionMode to required.

nested_items.name: ReplicationGroup
nested_items.description: Contains all of the attributes of a specific Valkey or Redis OSS replication group.

nested_items.name: ReplicationGroupId
nested_items.description: The identifier for the replication group.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: The user supplied description of the replication group.

nested_items.name: GlobalReplicationGroupInfo
nested_items.description: The name of the Global datastore and role of this replication group in the Global datastore.

nested_items.name: GlobalReplicationGroupId
nested_items.description: The name of the Global datastore.

nested_items.name: GlobalReplicationGroupMemberRole
nested_items.description: The role of the replication group in a Global datastore. Can be primary or secondary.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The current state of this replication group - creating, available, modifying, deleting, create-failed, snapshotting.

nested_items.name: PendingModifiedValues
nested_items.description: A group of settings to be applied to the replication group, either immediately or during the next maintenance window.

nested_items.name: PrimaryClusterId
nested_items.description: The primary cluster ID that is applied immediately (if --apply-immediately was specified), or during the next maintenance window.

nested_items.name: AutomaticFailoverStatus
nested_items.description: Indicates the status of automatic failover for this Valkey or Redis OSS replication group.

nested_items.name: Resharding
nested_items.description: The status of an online resharding operation.

nested_items.name: SlotMigration
nested_items.description: Represents the progress of an online resharding operation.

nested_items.name: ProgressPercentage
nested_items.description: The percentage of the slot migration that is complete.

nested_items.name: AuthTokenStatus
nested_items.description: The auth token status.

nested_items.name: UserGroups
nested_items.description: The user group being modified.

nested_items.name: UserGroupIdsToAdd
nested_items.description: The ID of the user group to add.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: UserGroupIdsToRemove
nested_items.description: The ID of the user group to remove.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: LogDeliveryConfigurations
nested_items.description: The log delivery configurations being modified.

nested_items.name: LogType
nested_items.description: Refers to slow-log or engine-log..

nested_items.name: DestinationType
nested_items.description: Returns the destination type, either CloudWatch Logs or Kinesis Data Firehose.

nested_items.name: DestinationDetails
nested_items.description: Configuration details of either a CloudWatch Logs destination or Kinesis Data Firehose destination.

nested_items.name: CloudWatchLogsDetails
nested_items.description: The configuration details of the CloudWatch Logs destination.

nested_items.name: LogGroup
nested_items.description: The name of the CloudWatch Logs log group.

nested_items.name: KinesisFirehoseDetails
nested_items.description: The configuration details of the Kinesis Data Firehose destination.

nested_items.name: DeliveryStream
nested_items.description: The name of the Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream.

nested_items.name: LogFormat
nested_items.description: Returns the log format, either JSON or TEXT.

nested_items.name: TransitEncryptionEnabled
nested_items.description: A flag that enables in-transit encryption when set to true.

nested_items.name: TransitEncryptionMode
nested_items.description: A setting that allows you to migrate your clients to use in-transit encryption, with no downtime.

nested_items.name: ClusterMode
nested_items.description: Enabled or Disabled. To modify cluster mode from Disabled to Enabled, you must first set the cluster mode to Compatible. Compatible mode allows your Valkey or Redis OSS clients to connect using both cluster mode enabled and cluster mode disabled. After you migrate all Valkey or Redis OSS clients to use cluster mode enabled, you can then complete cluster mode configuration and set the cluster mode to Enabled.

nested_items.name: MemberClusters
nested_items.description: The names of all the cache clusters that are part of this replication group.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: NodeGroups
nested_items.description: A list of node groups in this replication group. For Valkey or Redis OSS (cluster mode disabled) replication groups, this is a single-element list. For Valkey or Redis OSS (cluster mode enabled) replication groups, the list contains an entry for each node group (shard).

nested_items.name: NodeGroupId
nested_items.description: The identifier for the node group (shard). A Valkey or Redis OSS (cluster mode disabled) replication group contains only 1 node group; therefore, the node group ID is 0001. A Valkey or Redis OSS (cluster mode enabled) replication group contains 1 to 90 node groups numbered 0001 to 0090. Optionally, the user can provide the id for a node group.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The current state of this replication group - creating, available, modifying, deleting.

nested_items.name: PrimaryEndpoint
nested_items.description: The endpoint of the primary node in this node group (shard).

nested_items.name: Address
nested_items.description: The DNS hostname of the cache node.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: The port number that the cache engine is listening on.

nested_items.name: ReaderEndpoint
nested_items.description: The endpoint of the replica nodes in this node group (shard). This value is read-only.

nested_items.name: Address
nested_items.description: The DNS hostname of the cache node.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: The port number that the cache engine is listening on.

nested_items.name: Slots
nested_items.description: The keyspace for this node group (shard).

nested_items.name: NodeGroupMembers
nested_items.description: A list containing information about individual nodes within the node group (shard).

nested_items.name: CacheClusterId
nested_items.description: The ID of the cluster to which the node belongs.

nested_items.name: CacheNodeId
nested_items.description: The ID of the node within its cluster. A node ID is a numeric identifier (0001, 0002, etc.).

nested_items.name: ReadEndpoint
nested_items.description: The information required for client programs to connect to a node for read operations. The read endpoint is only applicable on Valkey or Redis OSS (cluster mode disabled) clusters.

nested_items.name: Address
nested_items.description: The DNS hostname of the cache node.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: The port number that the cache engine is listening on.

nested_items.name: PreferredAvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: The name of the Availability Zone in which the node is located.

nested_items.name: PreferredOutpostArn
nested_items.description: The outpost ARN of the node group member.

nested_items.name: CurrentRole
nested_items.description: The role that is currently assigned to the node - primary or replica. This member is only applicable for Valkey or Redis OSS (cluster mode disabled) replication groups.

nested_items.name: SnapshottingClusterId
nested_items.description: The cluster ID that is used as the daily snapshot source for the replication group.

nested_items.name: AutomaticFailover
nested_items.description: Indicates the status of automatic failover for this Valkey or Redis OSS replication group.

nested_items.name: MultiAZ
nested_items.description: A flag indicating if you have Multi-AZ enabled to enhance fault tolerance. For more information, see Minimizing Downtime: Multi-AZ.

nested_items.name: ConfigurationEndpoint
nested_items.description: The configuration endpoint for this replication group. Use the configuration endpoint to connect to this replication group.

nested_items.name: Address
nested_items.description: The DNS hostname of the cache node.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: The port number that the cache engine is listening on.

nested_items.name: SnapshotRetentionLimit
nested_items.description: The number of days for which ElastiCache retains automatic cluster snapshots before deleting them. For example, if you set SnapshotRetentionLimit to 5, a snapshot that was taken today is retained for 5 days before being deleted.

nested_items.name: SnapshotWindow
nested_items.description: The daily time range (in UTC) during which ElastiCache begins taking a daily snapshot of your node group (shard).

nested_items.name: ClusterEnabled
nested_items.description: A flag indicating whether or not this replication group is cluster enabled; i.e., whether its data can be partitioned across multiple shards (API/CLI: node groups).

nested_items.name: CacheNodeType
nested_items.description: The name of the compute and memory capacity node type for each node in the replication group.

nested_items.name: AuthTokenEnabled
nested_items.description: A flag that enables using an AuthToken (password) when issuing Valkey or Redis OSS commands.

nested_items.name: AuthTokenLastModifiedDate
nested_items.description: The date the auth token was last modified.

nested_items.name: TransitEncryptionEnabled
nested_items.description: A flag that enables in-transit encryption when set to true.

nested_items.name: AtRestEncryptionEnabled
nested_items.description: A flag that enables encryption at-rest when set to true.

nested_items.name: MemberClustersOutpostArns
nested_items.description: The outpost ARNs of the replication group's member clusters.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The ID of the KMS key used to encrypt the disk in the cluster.

nested_items.name: ARN
nested_items.description: The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of the replication group.

nested_items.name: UserGroupIds
nested_items.description: The ID of the user group associated to the replication group.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: LogDeliveryConfigurations
nested_items.description: Returns the destination, format and type of the logs.

nested_items.name: LogType
nested_items.description: Refers to slow-log or engine-log.

nested_items.name: DestinationType
nested_items.description: Returns the destination type, either cloudwatch-logs or kinesis-firehose.

nested_items.name: DestinationDetails
nested_items.description: Configuration details of either a CloudWatch Logs destination or Kinesis Data Firehose destination.

nested_items.name: CloudWatchLogsDetails
nested_items.description: The configuration details of the CloudWatch Logs destination.

nested_items.name: LogGroup
nested_items.description: The name of the CloudWatch Logs log group.

nested_items.name: KinesisFirehoseDetails
nested_items.description: The configuration details of the Kinesis Data Firehose destination.

nested_items.name: DeliveryStream
nested_items.description: The name of the Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream.

nested_items.name: LogFormat
nested_items.description: Returns the log format, either JSON or TEXT.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: Returns the log delivery configuration status. Values are one of enabling | disabling | modifying | active | error.

nested_items.name: Message
nested_items.description: Returns an error message for the log delivery configuration.

nested_items.name: ReplicationGroupCreateTime
nested_items.description: The date and time when the cluster was created.

nested_items.name: DataTiering
nested_items.description: Enables data tiering. Data tiering is only supported for replication groups using the r6gd node type. This parameter must be set to true when using r6gd nodes. For more information, see Data tiering.

nested_items.name: AutoMinorVersionUpgrade
nested_items.description: If you are running Valkey 7.2 and above, or Redis OSS engine version 6.0 and above, set this parameter to yes if you want to opt-in to the next auto minor version upgrade campaign. This parameter is disabled for previous versions.

nested_items.name: NetworkType
nested_items.description: Must be either ipv4 | ipv6 | dual_stack. IPv6 is supported for workloads using Valkey 7.2 and above, Redis OSS engine version 6.2 to 7.1 or Memcached engine version 1.6.6 and above on all instances built on the Nitro system.

nested_items.name: IpDiscovery
nested_items.description: The network type you choose when modifying a cluster, either ipv4 | ipv6. IPv6 is supported for workloads using Valkey 7.2 and above, Redis OSS engine version 6.2 to 7.1 or Memcached engine version 1.6.6 and above on all instances built on the Nitro system.

nested_items.name: TransitEncryptionMode
nested_items.description: A setting that allows you to migrate your clients to use in-transit encryption, with no downtime.

nested_items.name: ClusterMode
nested_items.description: Enabled or Disabled. To modify cluster mode from Disabled to Enabled, you must first set the cluster mode to Compatible. Compatible mode allows your Valkey or Redis OSS clients to connect using both cluster mode enabled and cluster mode disabled. After you migrate all Valkey or Redis OSS clients to use cluster mode enabled, you can then complete cluster mode configuration and set the cluster mode to Enabled.

nested_items.name: Engine
nested_items.description: The engine used in a replication group. The options are redis, memcached or valkey.
